channel.title: When finding bitmap it moves mouse to random location instead of bitmap location
channel.description: [code]procedure backtoarmoury; begin If(Findbitmap(back,x,y))Then begin movemouse(x,y) end; end;[/code] Whats wrong with this code?

item.title: When finding bitmap it moves mouse to random location instead of bitmap location
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Say I picked a bitmap, 4 by 4 of plain black. It will click the first 4 by 4 square of black it spots, in the first pixel. Make bitmaps, ‘unique’.

item.title: When finding bitmap it moves mouse to random location instead of bitmap location
item.dc:creator: @Westside_Rep Westside Rep
item.description:
@Westside_Rep wrote:

Get rid of the second begin and the second end, that will work, also you have to put ClickMouse(x,y,true). Or just use juniors code (only if youre using srl, because it could effect the other scripts you might be using.

Read full topic

item.title: When finding bitmap it moves mouse to random location instead of bitmap location
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

if you want it make if find and click on bitmaps use this.

[scar]
program New;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

procedure ClickBMPS;
begin
wait(300+random(32));
movemousesmooth(x,y);
wait(300+random(1589));
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;

procedure findBMP;
begin
if (findBitmap(Xbmp, x, y))then
begin
wait(1000+random(1000));
clickBMPS;
end;
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
FindBMP;
end.
[/scar]

Dont use that whole procedure but that should give you a idea.
Need anymore help just ask.
~Jr

[br][size=1]Posted at: September 18, 2006, 07:28:30 PM[/size][hr]And what are you making a bitmap of?

Read full topic
